snippet: Absent Congressional action, the country faces more than half a trillion dollars in tax increases and spending cuts next year, and semantic debate has sprung up alongside the policy debate.
abstract: Vigorous semantic debate has sprung up alongside heated policy debate, as United States faces more than half trillion dollars in tax increases and spending cuts if Congress does not enact debt reduction plan by end of 2012; tortured metaphors like fiscal cliff or debtpocalypse are being tossed about by politicians, economists and pundits.
lead_paragraph: Absent Congressional action, the country faces more than half a trillion dollars in tax increases and spending cuts next year, and semantic debate has sprung up alongside the policy debate.

headline.seo: Fiscal Cliff? Slope? Debtpocalypse? It Means Austerity
headline.main: Whether ‘Fiscal Cliff’ or Debtpocalypse, by Any Name, It Spells Austerity
headline.print_headline: Whether ‘Fiscal Cliff’ or Debtpocalypse, by Any Name, It Spells Austerity
